course.subject: COMP
course.name: Optimization for Machine Learning
course.description:
This course covers modern optimization methods for machine learning applications. We will discuss both theory and implementation of common optimization algorithms in the context of machine learning applications. The topics covered include convex optimization, stochastic optimization, nonconvex optimization, and distributed optimization. Knowledge with calculus, linear 
algebra, and probability, basic machine learning are required.

reviews.author: Pony
reviews.title: A very nice topic
reviews.comment_content: Basic optimization knowledge with a strong combination to machine learning and other related fields.  The math is heavy for the theoretical optimization analysis but insights are valuable. Also variance reduction SGD is very interesting as this is what Tong is famous for.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not so vivid but basically acceptable. Slides are to math concentrated , the examples are too bland.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments with coding work, may not be hard for CS students who are familiar with python. But not so friendly to hands-on for math students with no coding experience.

reviews.author: Clint
reviews.comment_content: Great Content. Professor is drafting a book, I can see the professor is dedicating a lot of time on this.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very bad teaching. Professor is not very good at delivering and his English is very poor.
reviews.comment_grading: Okayish grading. I got an B+ for avreage grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework is very hard. Includes programming and theoretical problems. Normally, theoretical problems are super hard if you are not very familiar with the contents. Programming problems are light-weighted but require a deep understanding of the topics. The final examination is a take-home exam.
